channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OAK-1247] Non-deterministic access control test failures
item.description:
As reported by Julian in OAK-928 and http://markmail.org/message/qpnjpbbw5h4mh7rc, some of the ACL related tests, most notably ShadowInvisibleContentTest#testAddNodeCollidingWithInvisibleNode, are failing semi-frequently.

Since the problem seems timing-dependent, I wonder if some of the caching from OAK-1138 might be causing this.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
OK; oak-core now passes, but I get ACL related test failures in oak-jcr-binding:

I also see such errors every now and then (roughly 10% of time).

I'm running on three test machines, all Win7, one of which old (32bit), and it seems it fails for machines with 4 cores (desktop), as opposed to two cores (notebook). Maybe a synchronization problem?

Edit: and, just a few minutes later, it now fails on my 2-core notebook as well.

This is becoming much more common; now my build fails most of the time because of this. The change in frequency might be due to the various recent lower level optimizations making synchronization issues more prominent.

I managed to narrow down the issue a bit to mvn clean test -pl oak-jcr -Dtest=RepositoryTest,authorization.*, which fails about 50% of the time for me.

If I had to make a guess at the cause of this issue, I'd look at the PermissionProvider instance that gets passed to the PermissionValidator through the CommitInfo object. That seems wrong, as the permissions against which a commit should be evaluated should come from the before state of that commit, not from a potentially different state of the repository.
Seems like my guess above is correct, as the above patch that makes the PermissionValidator use the before state as the basis of the PermissionProvider seems to fix the issue.
I still see test failures related to ACLs. Maybe different ones

I still see test failures related to ACLs.

After you apply the attached patch?

Yes:
